snippet: Why it’s so hard for consumers to fix faulty credit reports.
abstract: Op-Ed article by policy experts Prof Jeff Sovern and Ira Rheingold notes confused files are only one of the reasons why it is so hard for consumers to fix faulty credit reports; holds Congress can take steps to give lenders greater rights against lenders, like improve accuracy by imposing liability on lenders who fail to investigate consumer complaints.

byline.original: By JEFF SOVERN and IRA RHEINGOLD

lead_paragraph: Why it’s so hard for consumers to fix faulty credit reports.
